revised_title: Investigating the Duration of Infectivity in Glossina Palpalis After Removal of Lake-shore Population
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the duration of infectivity in Glossina palpalis after the removal of the Lake-shore population in Uganda. They found that the flies can retain their infectivity for up to 80 days, which is crucial for re-inhabiting the area and preventing the spread of sleeping sickness.
